Lab:
====

1) listener.ora and tnsnames.ora

[oracle@dbnode2 admin]$ cat listener.ora 
# listener.ora Network Configuration File: /u01/app/oracle/product/12.2.0.1/dbhome_1/network/admin/listener.ora
# Generated by Oracle configuration tools.

LISTENER_DEVDB =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = TCP)(HOST = dbnode2.localdomain.com)(PORT = 1521))
  )

ADR_BASE_LISTENER = /u01/app/oracle


[oracle@dbnode2 admin]$ cat tnsnames.ora 
# tnsnames.ora Network Configuration File: /u01/app/oracle/product/12.2.0.1/dbhome_1/network/admin/tnsnames.ora
# Generated by Oracle configuration tools.

DEVDB =
  (DESCRIPTION =
    (ADDRESS = (PROTOCOL = TCP)(HOST = dbnode2)(PORT = 1521))
    (CONNECT_DATA =
      (SERVER = DEDICATED)
      (SERVICE_NAME = DEVDB)
    )
  )
[oracle@dbnode2 admin]$ 


listener.ora and tnsnames.ora configuration using netca & netmgr

Listener Dynamic Registration and Static Registration - Why do we need local listener?

2) Shared server connection or dedecated server connection

Connecting to the Oracle Database Instance - tnsnames.ora - Connection String

Connecting to the Database Instance - listener.ora - Client Connection

Database Connection - Client Connectivity Dedicated Server Process || Shared Server Process


3) DB Link:
Local DB: DEVDB 
Remote DB: TESTDB 
>>> Currently I loged in DEVDB but employee table available in TESTDB
>>> I want to access employee table from DEVDB 

tnsping TESTDB >>> if not able to ping then add tnsnames.ora file with TESTDB details 

CREATE DATABASE LINK DBLINK_NAME 		john/john is a user in TESTDB
USING 'TESTDB';							>>>>>>> Remote DB tnsdetails (TESTDB)
